metadata.Description: Collaborative initiatives involving multiple stakeholders, such as governments, businesses, and civil society organizations.

level 1.Description: Multi-stakeholder partnerships employ collaborative decision-making processes to ensure diverse perspectives and expertise in sustainable energy initiatives.
Multi-stakeholder partnerships collaborate with the private sector to leverage resources and expertise for the implementation of sustainable energy projects.
Multi-stakeholder partnerships support capacity building initiatives to enhance knowledge and skills in sustainable energy practices.
Multi-stakeholder partnerships administer energy efficiency programs to promote the adoption of energy-saving practices and technologies.
Multi-stakeholder partnerships measure carbon footprint to assess the environmental impact of sustainable energy initiatives and identify areas for improvement.
Multi-stakeholder partnerships align with the Sustainable Development Goals to contribute to the achievement of targets related to sustainable energy and climate action.
Multi-stakeholder partnerships are an instance of collaborative governance, where diverse stakeholders come together to address sustainable energy challenges.

level 2.Subject: energy efficiency
level 2.Description: Energy efficiency measures address energy waste by promoting the use of energy-efficient technologies and practices.

level 2.Subject: energy efficiency
level 2.Description: Energy efficiency employs energy audits to identify energy-saving opportunities and optimize energy use.

level 2.Subject: energy efficiency
level 2.Description: Energy efficiency collaborates with industries to develop and implement energy-saving measures and technologies.

level 2.Subject: energy efficiency
level 2.Description: Energy efficiency supports the integration of renewable energy sources into the energy system to improve overall energy efficiency.

level 2.Subject: energy efficiency
level 2.Description: Energy efficiency administers energy efficiency programs to promote energy-saving behaviors and technologies.

level 2.Subject: energy efficiency
level 2.Description: Energy efficiency measures energy performance to assess the effectiveness of energy-saving initiatives.

level 2.Subject: energy efficiency
level 2.Description: Energy efficiency aligns with the Sustainable Development Goals by contributing to the goal of affordable and clean energy for all.

level 2.Subject: energy efficiency
level 2.Description: Energy efficiency is an instance of energy conservation, which aims to reduce energy consumption and waste.

level 3.Subject: energy storage
level 3.Description: Energy storage addresses the issue of intermittency in renewable energy sources by storing excess energy for use during periods of low generation.

level 3.Subject: energy markets
level 3.Description: Energy markets address the issue of energy access by ensuring the availability and affordability of energy sources for all segments of society.

level 3.Subject: renewable energy certificates
level 3.Description: Renewable energy certificates are implemented by the Energy Efficiency Policy to promote the use of renewable energy sources.

level 3.Subject: energy efficiency
level 3.Description: Energy efficiency measures address energy waste by promoting the use of energy-efficient technologies and practices.
